title: How Suburban Are Big American Cities FiveThirtyEight » Features | FiveThirtyEight

type_specific.selection: What, exactly, is a city? Technically, cities are legal designations that, under state laws, have specific public powers and functions. But many of the largest American cities — especially in the South and West — don’t feel like cities, at least not in the high-rise-and-subways, “Sesame Street” sense.
